intro: Stephanophorum luteum, commonly known as the yellow stephanophorum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant yellow blooms. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
